{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.04126v1", "title": "Role of $Σ^*(1/2^-)$ baryons in decay $Λ_c\to
  Λπ^+π^+π^-$", "summary": "In this work, based on Belle data, we investigate the structure around 1435
MeV and the role of the $\Sigma(1380)$ resonance in the decay process
$\Lambda_c \to \Lambda \pi^- \pi^+ \pi^+$. The $\Lambda \pi^\pm$ invariant mass
spectra are approximately reproduced by the contribution from the
$\Sigma(1385)$, modeled as a Breit-Wigner resonance combined with background
terms. However, an additional component is required to account for the
pronounced enhancement near 1435 MeV. To describe this structure, we consider
two scenarios for the $\Sigma(1435)$: one as a Breit-Wigner resonance with
spin-parity $1/2^-$ described via effective Lagrangians, and the other as a
rescattering effect arising from coupled-channel interactions. The rescattering
contributions are evaluated using the quasipotential Bethe-Salpeter equation
approach. Simulated invariant mass spectra are generated and fitted to the
experimental data. Both the Breit-Wigner and rescattering mechanisms provide
reasonable descriptions of the enhancement near 1435 MeV, with the Breit-Wigner
scenario yielding a slightly better $\chi^2$. However, the rescattering
approach naturally generates a cusp-like structure near threshold, which
closely resembles the feature observed in the data. Furthermore, the inclusion
of the $\Sigma(1380)$ resonance with spin-parity $1/2^-$ significantly improves
the fit in the low-energy region and further enhances the description near 1435
MeV through interference effects. These results underscore the essential roles
of the two $\Sigma^*(1/2^-)$ states in accurately describing the invariant mass
distributions in the decay $\Lambda_c \to \Lambda \pi^+ \pi^+ \pi^-$.", "main_category": "hep-ph", "categories": "hep-ph", "published": "2025-05-07T04:48:05Z"}
